Dipakai Tiap Hari, Seberapa Sering Botol Air Minum Harus Dicuci?
05 Nov 2019, 06:45 by Tempo.co, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Masyarakat perkotaan kini banyak yang beralih menggunakan botol air minum isi ulang. Selain hemat, kebiasaan ini juga baik untuk mengurangi sampah plastik yang sulit terurai di planet ini.
Karena digunakan setiap saat, Anda harus menjamin kebersihan botol air minum Anda. Seberapa sering sebaiknya Anda mencucinya?
Menurut ahli mikrobiologi & peneliti senior dari Lembaga Penelitian Murdoch Children Australia, Celeste Donato, Anda harus membersihkan botol air secara teratur setelah setiap kali digunakan. Bukan air dalam botol Anda yang menjadi masalah, tapi mulut Anda yang menyentuhnya setiap kali minum.
"Mulut Anda dapat mengandung virus dan bakteri yang mungkin masuk ke botol air saat minum,‚Äù kata Donato seperti dikutip Bustle, Selasa, 5 November 2019. "Sebagian besar bakteri dan virus itu tidak akan membuat Anda sakit, tetapi mereka dalam kondisi yang berbeda-beda."
Meskipun rajin menyikat gigi, mulut dan air liur Anda mengandung bakteri yang tertinggal setelah selesai minum. Menurut menurut Journal of Microbiology, ada lebih dari 700 jenis bakteri yang hidup di mulut. Bakteri itu bisa tersebar jika Anda berbagi botol dengan orang lain dan tidak mencucinya, bahkan jika hanya menyentuhnya dengan tangan.
"Anda menyentuh banyak permukaan yang berbeda sepanjang hari, beberapa di antaranya mungkin sangat kotor seperti rel tangan di angkutan umum dan pegangan pintu di toilet umum, mengambil bakteri dan virus di tangan Anda," kata Donato.
Anda juga perlu memperhatikan tempat mengisi ulang air minum. Jika Anda mengisinya di gym, botol Anda mungkin bisa terpapar bakteri atau virus di udara atau dari keringat tubuh orang lain. Sebuah studi 2018 yang dilakukan di Brazil dan diterbitkan dalam Journal of Exercise Physiology melihat dengan tepat menggunakan 30 botol yang diberikan kepada pengunjung gym. Setelah memeriksa botol air subjek setelah sesi olahraga mereka, studi ini menemukan 25 botol air menunjukkan pertumbuhan bakteri, termasuk E. Coli.
Lalu bagaimana membersihkan botol air minum yang benar? Salah satu caranya adalah mengisinya dengan air hangat, tambahkan beberapa tetes sabun cuci piring, dan kocok. Setelah itu, bilas botol Anda beberapa kali sampai bersih dan berbau. Anda juga dapat membersihkan botol air menggunakan cuka atau soda bikarbonat.

Used Every Day, How Often Should Drinking Water Bottles be Washed?
05 Nov 2019, 06:45 by Tempo.co, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Many urban communities are now turning to using refilled drinking water bottles. Besides saving, this habit is also good for reducing the plastic waste that is difficult to decompose on the planet.
Because it is used all the time, you must guarantee the cleanliness of your drinking water bottles. How often should you wash it?
According to microbiologist & senior researcher from the Australian Murdoch Children Research Institute, Celeste Donato, you should clean your water bottles regularly after each use. It's not the water in your bottle that's the problem, it's your mouth that touches it every time you drink.
"Your mouth can contain viruses and bacteria that might enter the water bottle while drinking," Donato was quoted as saying by Bustle, Tuesday, November 5, 2019. "Most of the bacteria and viruses will not make you sick, but they are in different conditions - different. "
Even though you regularly brush your teeth, your mouth and saliva contain bacteria that are left after drinking. According to the Journal of Microbiology, there are more than 700 types of bacteria that live in the mouth. The bacteria can spread if you share the bottle with others and don't wash it, even if you only touch it with your hands.
"You touch many different surfaces throughout the day, some of which may be very dirty like hand rails on public transportation and door handles in public toilets, picking up bacteria and viruses in your hands," Donato said.
You also need to pay attention to where to refill drinking water. If you fill it in the gym, your bottle might be exposed to bacteria or viruses in the air or from the sweat of other people's bodies. A 2018 study conducted in Brazil and published in the Journal of Exercise Physiology looked precisely at using 30 bottles given to gym visitors. After examining the subject's water bottles after their exercise session, the study found 25 bottles of water showed bacterial growth, including E. Coli.
Then how to clean drinking water bottles properly? One way is to fill it with warm water, add a few drops of dish soap, and shake it. After that, rinse your bottle several times until it is clean and smelly. You can also clean the water bottle using vinegar or bicarbonate of soda.
